FacilityName: ST. FRANCIS MERCANTILE - IN TOWN PLANT
ParentCompanyName: THE ST. FRANCIS MERCANTILE EQUITY EXCHANGE

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
OUR COMPANY IS AN AGRICULTURAL RETAIL BUSINESS THAT SPECIALIZES IN PROVIDING AREA PRODUCERS WITH THE NECESSARY INPUTS FOR GRAIN,  AND OTHER SPECALITY CROP PRODUCTION.  THIS COMPANY STRIVES TO MAINTAIN A SAFE AND HEALTHY WORK PLACE.  OUR OWNERS, MANAGERS, AND EMPLOYEES HAVE MADE EVERY EFFORT TO PLAN THE PREVENTION OF ANY ACCIDENTAL RELEASE OF ANYDROUS AMMONIA.

THE WORST CASE AND ALTERNATE RELEASE SCENARIOS HAVE BEEN EVALUATED AND SHARED WITH OUR FIRST RESPONDERS AS PART OF AN ON-GOING TRAINING PROGRAM.  MORE IMPORTANTLY, OUR EMPLOYEES HAVE BEEN TRAINED IN THEIR RESPECTIVE EMERGENCY ACTIONS, INCLUDING THE EMERGENCY MEETING PLACE AND EACH OF THEIR RESPONSIBILITIES REGARDING AN ACCIDENTAL RELEASE OF ANHYDROUS AMMONIA.

THIS COMPANY MAINTAINS AND OPERATES THEIR NH3 PLANTS IN STRICT ACCORDANCE WITH ALL STATE AND LOCAL AUTHORITIES.  THE KANSAS DEPARTMENT OF AGRICULTURE INSPECTS OUR PLANTS ON A REGULAR BASIS AND WE COMPLY WITH THEIR REQUESTS FOR IMPROVEMENT.  CHANGES OR IMPROVMENTS IN THE FACILIITY'S EQUIPMENT WILL BE ACTED UPON IMMEDIATELY FOLLWING THE ENFORCEMENT AGENCY'S (KDA'sDC) REQUEST, OR AS FOUND TO BE NECESSARY BY OUR MAINTENANCE STAFF.

OUR EMPLOYEES ARE TRAINED IN SAFETY PROCEDURES, SITE SPECIFIC OPERATING PROCEDURES AND PLANT MAINTANENCE.  THEY ARE COMPETENCY TESTED OVER THE TRAINING MATERIAL.  EACH EMPLOYEE USES GOOGLES AND GLOVES DURING AMMONIA OPERATIONS AS WELL AS ALWAYS PROVIDING PLENTY OF EMERGENCY SAFETY WATER DURING NURSE TANK LOADING OPERATIONS.

WITH THE ABOVE-MENTIONED TRAINING IN MIND, IT MAKES IT VERY EASY TO REPORT THAT ABSOLUTLY NO INJURY, ACCIDENTS, OR PROPERTY DAMAGE HAS OCCURRED AT THIS FACILITY IN THE LAST FIVE YEARS.

OUR EMERGENCY ACTION PLAN IS DESIGNED TO MINIMIZE THE RISKS TO EMPLOYEES, THE SURROUNDING PUBLIC, AND THE AREA FIRST RESPONDERS.  THIS COMPANY PROVIDES PLANT TOURS FOR THE LOCAL FIRE DEPARTMENT AND OUR ACTION PLAN HAS BEEN SHARED WITH THE LOCAL EMERGENCY PLANNING AUTHORITY. (LEPC).  EACH OF OUR RESPONDING AGENCIES ARE AWARE OF
THE DANGEROUS NATURE OF ANHYDROUS AMMONIA AND THEY HAVE AGREED TO ASSIST US IN THE EVENT OF AN EMERGENCY OR ACCIDENTAL RELEASE.
